required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Acupuncture on IVF Pregnancy Outcomes for Women With RIF
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Acupuncture on IVF Pregnancy Outcomes for Women With Recurrent Implantation Failure: a Multi-center Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The randomized, placebo-controlled multicenter trial is conducted in five centers in China. After screening and obtaining the signed informed consent , the participants are randomly divided into two groups: acupuncture +IVF group and sham acupuncture +IVF group.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

intervention.description: Acupuncture was performed three times a week for 30 minutes each time, starting from the 5th day of menstruation and ending within 24 hours after embryo transfer.
Sham acupuncture was performed three times a week for 30 minutes each time, starting from the 5th day of menstruation and ending within 24 hours after embryo transfer.

overall_official.affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
